subject: Remove neutron sidecar containers in more reliable way
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-04 13:52:56.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/neutron/kill-script'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/24ccfc662c49c3d6c7e9a0b6bba68c1483455d3c', 'message': 'Remove neutron sidecar containers in more reliable way

Previously kill-script used by Neutron agents to kill sidecar
containers was sending TERM signal to container when it was going to be
closed with SIGTERM. After that it was immediatelly trying to remove
container with "podman rm" command.
Sometimes, if container wasn't really stopped yet when "podman rm" was
used, removal of container failed and there was leftover sidecar on the
host.
Now kill-script will instead use "podman stop" command which will send
TERM to the container and wait some time (10 seconds by default) until
it will be really stopped before it will try to delete container.

Additionally this patch improves logging in different functions in
kill-script.

Closes: rhbz#2080811
Change-Id: If893bb6883843bea48c50c47b98f182cacdd50b8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove neutron sidecar containers in more reliable way

Previously kill-script used by Neutron agents to kill sidecar
containers was sending TERM signal to container when it was going to be
closed with SIGTERM. After that it was immediatelly trying to remove
container with "podman rm" command.
Sometimes, if container wasn't really stopped yet when "podman rm" was
used, removal of container failed and there was leftover sidecar on the
host.
Now kill-script will instead use "podman stop" command which will send
TERM to the container and wait some time (10 seconds by default) until
it will be really stopped before it will try to delete container.

Additionally this patch improves logging in different functions in
kill-script.

Closes: rhbz#2080811
Change-Id: If893bb6883843bea48c50c47b98f182cacdd50b8

commit_message:
Add /recon/module_versions endpoint

This endpoint will query sys.modules and attempt to list the versions
for all the modules (with easily found versions) loaded in the server.

As an example, here is a container-server running in my VSAIO:

    vagrant@saio1:~$ curl http://127.0.0.1:6011/recon/module_versions |jq .
    [
      [
	"sys",
	"3.10.6 (main, Nov 14 2022, 16:10:14) [GCC 11.3.0]"
      ],
      [
	"marshal",
	"4"
      ],
      [
	"platform",
	"1.0.8"
      ],
      [
	"pyexpat",
	"2.4.7"
      ],
      [
	"xml.parsers.expat",
	"2.4.7"
      ],
      [
	"pkg_resources._vendor.packaging",
	"21.2"
      ],
      [
	"pkg_resources.extern.packaging",
	"21.2"
      ],
      [
	"importlib.metadata",
	"version() missing 1 required positional argument: 'distribution_name'"
      ],
      [
	"distutils",
	"3.10.6"
      ],
      [
	"OpenSSL",
	"23.0.0"
      ],
      [
	"__patched_module_dns",
	"2.3.0"
      ],
      [
	"dns",
	"2.3.0"
      ],
      [
	"chardet",
	"5.1.0"
      ],
      [
	"charset_normalizer",
	"3.1.0"
      ],
      [
	"requests.packages.chardet",
	"5.1.0"
      ],
      [
	"dns.version",
	"2.3.0"
      ],
      [
	"__patched_module_dns.version",
	"2.3.0"
      ],
      [
	"eventlet",
	"0.33.3"
      ],
      [
	"netifaces",
	"0.11.0"
      ],
      [
	"_sqlite3",
	"2.6.0"
      ],
      [
	"sqlite3.dbapi2",
	"2.6.0"
      ],
      [
	"sqlite3",
	"2.6.0"
      ]
    ]

Change-Id: I9dcd5f94f710d05a10848be98fad36e7c24a5c61

commit_message:
Fix NoSuchOptError error in Ipam unit tests

Sometimes running the ML2 plugin unit tests generates an
error in unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py

oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchOptError: no such option ipam_driver in group [DEFAULT]

The specific test I see triggering it is:

neutron.tests.unit.plugins.ml2.test_plugin.
TestML2PluggableIPAM.test_delete_subnet_deallocates_slaac_correctly

Problem is that setUp() in the UseIpamMixin class isn't
registering the core options before trying to override
ipam_driver.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I5f29b0feaa89b31bc41ea67ea1c6231fd3f7fa05

commit_message:
Set the correct path for pacemaker logs in rsyslog

Log path for pacemaker is set to "PacemakerLoggingSource"
which exists on the host, not inside the container.

This change introduces a new variable `PacemakerRsyslogLoggingSource`
which hold the correct path for pacemaker logs mounted inside
rsyslog container under "/var/log/host/pacemaker/".

Likewise, similar variables can be configured for log files of
other host services which are mounted under "/var/log/host/".

Resolves: rhbz#2180933
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/878736
Change-Id: I1953db2faff367cd5f06ef3ce530ccd00cc7dc6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/37/878737/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PacemakerRsyslogLoggingSource: type: json default: tag: system.pacemaker file: /var/log/host/pacemaker/pacemaker.log startmsg.regex: "^[a-zA-Z]{3} [0-9]{2} [:0-9]{8}" tripleo_host_logging_sources_pacemaker: - {get_param: PacemakerRsyslogLoggingSource}

Set the correct path for pacemaker logs in rsyslog

Log path for pacemaker is set to "PacemakerLoggingSource"
which exists on the host, not inside the container.

This change introduces a new variable `PacemakerRsyslogLoggingSource`
which hold the correct path for pacemaker logs mounted inside
rsyslog container under "/var/log/host/pacemaker/".

Likewise, similar variables can be configured for log files of
other host services which are mounted under "/var/log/host/".

Resolves: rhbz#2180933

subject: Rsyslog configuration holds incorect log path of host services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-04 06:01:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/6606569e166a94ae99043d0a3dbdc39b8b47e2c1', 'message': 'Rsyslog configuration holds incorect log path of host services

commit_message:
Rsyslog configuration holds incorect log path of host services

Host services (like pacemaker) logs are mounted inside rsyslog
container under "/var/log/host". It tries to find the logs for
the host services in the container under the same path
"/var/log/" as the host, which will not exist.

This change accounts for the different mount points for log
files of host and containerized services. To override log path
for any host service "tripleo_host_logging_sources_<service>"
must be set in THT.

Resolves: rhbz#2180933
Change-Id: I117493244911d8c586831c817f0df1ca1052998d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/93/879393/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*container_sources*] # (Optional) List of hashes. Contains configuration of file inputs for container services.# [*host_sources*] # (Optional) List of hashes. Contains configuration of file inputs for host services. # Defaults to lookup("tripleo_host_logging_sources_${title}", undef, undef, undef) # $container_sources = lookup("tripleo_logging_sources_${title}", undef, undef, undef), $host_sources = lookup("tripleo_host_logging_sources_${title}", undef, undef, undef), if $host_sources { $sources = $host_sources } else { $sources = $container_sources }
deleted_lines: # [*sources*] # (Optional) List of hashes. Contains configuration of file inputs for given service. $sources = lookup("tripleo_logging_sources_${title}", undef, undef, undef),

commit_message:
Rsyslog configuration holds incorect log path of host services

Host services (like pacemaker) logs are mounted inside rsyslog
container under "/var/log/host". It tries to find the logs for
the host services in the container under the same path
"/var/log/" as the host, which will not exist.

This change accounts for the different mount points for log
files of host and containerized services. To override log path
for any host service "tripleo_host_logging_sources_<service>"
must be set in THT.

Resolves: rhbz#2180933
Change-Id: I117493244911d8c586831c817f0df1ca1052998d

commit_message:
Fix setting the tempest virtual env constraints env var

Heat upgrade script set the env var TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE
which are used to use the constraints during Tempest virtual env
installation. Those env var are set to non-master constraint when
we need to use non-master constraints but when we need to use the
master constraints we do not set/reset them point to master constraints.

This create the issue when this grenade script install the tempest with
stable constraints but with master Tempest and as there is mismatch of
constraints now with fasteners of stable branches. Below is failure
of heat greande job on stable/yoga

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/3aaec4d59bb84068bb4d4428ea747cbd/log/controller/logs/grenade.sh_log.txt#3245

Similar way, role should set stable constraints only for the stable EM branch
not for all otherwise it fail when constraints/requirements are bumped.

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/74f86b8097f44c35acaffdcfe41d9693

We should set/reset those constraint env var to master constraints if configuration
tell to use the master constraints.

Note:
This backport includes change Ie552e6398c10797e4df4afe757760c48ca7f80af
to unblock gate by a single commit.

Closes-Bug: #2003993
Change-Id: I024cd134577338fc1075e7742df7f006dc914646
(cherry picked from commit dbbba907d396158ce3bf3a207a8875b9fbb5a5b1)

(cherry picked from commit 1360cfdfa3026ce09e86c9f67e38c390229477fd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/56/872056/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(gmann): heat script does not know about # TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS, only DevStack does. # This sources that one variable from it. TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS=$(set +o xtrace && source $devstack_dir/stackrc && echo $TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS) # NOTE(gmann): If gate explicitly set the non master # constraints to use for Tempest venv then use the same # while running the tests too otherwise, it will recreate # the Tempest venv due to constraints mismatch. # recreation of Tempest venv can flush the initially installed # tempest plugins and their deps. if [[ "$TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS" != "master" ]]; then echo "Using $TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS constraints in Tempest virtual env." # NOTE: setting both tox env var and once Tempest start using new var # TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE then we can remove the old one. export UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=$TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS export TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=$TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS else # NOTE(gmann): we need to set the below env var pointing to master # constraints even that is what default in tox.ini. Otherwise it # can create the issue for grenade run where old and new devstack # can have different tempest (old and master) to install. For # detail problem, refer to the # https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/2003993 export UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/master export TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/master fi

commit_message:
Added a unit test for get_environment_hidden_param

A unit test for verifying that hidden parameters should
be masked in the get stack environment API

Story: 2010555
Task: 47229
Change-Id: I44ef26849ebb450a5643907a0ef47166cfd9b1cb
(cherry picked from commit bdcb2c3bd115f1893baeab1d946eefa4aab49552)

added_lines: def test_get_environment_hidden_param(self): # Setup env = { 'parameters': { 'admin': 'testuser', 'pass': 'pa55w0rd' }, 'parameter_defaults': { 'secret': 'dummy' }, 'resource_registry': { 'res': 'resource.yaml' } } t = { 'heat_template_version': '2018-08-31', 'parameters': { 'admin': {'type': 'string'}, 'pass': {'type': 'string', 'hidden': True} }, 'resources': { 'res1': {'type': 'res'} } } files = { 'resource.yaml': ''' heat_template_version: 2018-08-31 parameters: secret: type: string hidden: true ''' } tmpl = templatem.Template(t, files=files) stack = parser.Stack(self.ctx, 'get_env_stack', tmpl) stack.store() mock_get_stack = self.patchobject(self.eng, '_get_stack') mock_get_stack.return_value = mock.MagicMock() mock_get_stack.return_value.raw_template.environment = env self.patchobject(templatem.Template, 'load', return_value=tmpl) # Test found = self.eng.get_environment(self.ctx, stack.identifier()) # Verify env['parameters']['pass'] = '******' env['parameter_defaults']['secret'] = '******' self.assertEqual(env, found)

commit_message:
Exclude latest gnupg2 & Pin to last good version

This adds exclude for gnupg2-2.3.3-3.el9 and downgrade to last good
version gnupg2.x86_64 2.3.3-2.el9 in centos9 branches for the related
bug hitting check/gate and periodics. This is a workaround to unblock
the gates.

Related-Bug: 2015309

Change-Id: Ifb1c06291b070159b43e4364a527fe8b81157704

commit_message:
Update url

The OpenStack project is currently maintained on opendev.org, with github.com serving as a mirror repository.

Replace the source code repository address for the python-swiftclient project from github.com to opendev.org.

Change-Id: I650a80cb45febc457c42360061faf3a9799e6131
(cherry picked from commit 5032b42b10548bda6d27dba81cfec2f95a67d91b)

subject: Remove neutron sidecar containers in more reliable way
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-04 13:53:28.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/neutron/kill-script'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/4fda8af21dfa2132ef7df1c8c3732c524176a02b', 'message': 'Remove neutron sidecar containers in more reliable way

Previously kill-script used by Neutron agents to kill sidecar
containers was sending TERM signal to container when it was going to be
closed with SIGTERM. After that it was immediatelly trying to remove
container with "podman rm" command.
Sometimes, if container wasn't really stopped yet when "podman rm" was
used, removal of container failed and there was leftover sidecar on the
host.
Now kill-script will instead use "podman stop" command which will send
TERM to the container and wait some time (10 seconds by default) until
it will be really stopped before it will try to delete container.

Additionally this patch improves logging in different functions in
kill-script.

Closes: rhbz#2080811
Change-Id: If893bb6883843bea48c50c47b98f182cacdd50b8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove neutron sidecar containers in more reliable way

Previously kill-script used by Neutron agents to kill sidecar
containers was sending TERM signal to container when it was going to be
closed with SIGTERM. After that it was immediatelly trying to remove
container with "podman rm" command.
Sometimes, if container wasn't really stopped yet when "podman rm" was
used, removal of container failed and there was leftover sidecar on the
host.
Now kill-script will instead use "podman stop" command which will send
TERM to the container and wait some time (10 seconds by default) until
it will be really stopped before it will try to delete container.

Additionally this patch improves logging in different functions in
kill-script.

Closes: rhbz#2080811
Change-Id: If893bb6883843bea48c50c47b98f182cacdd50b8

commit_message:
[stable-only] Pin tox version

Modify project.yaml file to use ensure_tox_version, which will
force the host to install tox3.

Tox.ini also needed to be modified to ensure that tox does not
upgrade itself to a version >= 4.

Change-Id: I7862336f6338ebbd70ac8dc9fc0aeb3c4d506e11
(cherry picked from commit f34641e138d4e11f6208011738ab43fd5f0f874f)

commit_message:
Drop bandit check B309

It was retired upstream: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/858

Continuing to list it causes CI failures like

    ERROR	Unknown test found in profile: B309

Change-Id: I52c535bd2078f25bb57c42a2c2c966247cd3094b
(cherry picked from commit 479a010165cefccf8da522e99a478ab9c780e9cd)
